Good morning SSD families,

McKinley, Meadow View and Diamond View Schools will remain closed through the end of the week. We will plan to hold our first day of the school year on Monday, August 31, 2020.

The Sheep Fire has wreaked havoc in our community and has displaced an unfortunate number of staff members and families within the Susanville School District. With containment and control of the fire still out of reach, we cannot safely open school at this time.

Thank you to the first responders and firefighters that have worked so hard to save our community. Their support has helped keep us safe throughout this past week. We hope that those displaced by the evacuations will be allowed to return home soon and prepare for the beginning of the school year next week. Thank you all for your patience and understanding in these difficult times!

post_text: We are excited to announce the debut of the Susanville School District App for Cell Phones! This exciting, new communication tool will allow parents, staff and community members to receive updates from the district and its three schools more rapidly. Parents can use the app to access the same information that you would find on each school's website, receive announcements, access Facebook pages and even check grades and pay lunch bills. Simple toggle switches will allow users to choose which schools will send messages. The App is available in both the Apple App Store as well as in Google Play- simply search for "Susanville School District." We hope you enjoy this new app and find it useful!

Community Pool Ribbon Cutting Ceremony

Susanville School District Board Members: Jenna Aguilera, Camille Buehler and Pam Woodworth joined Superintendent, Jason Waddell at today’s ribbon cutting ceremony at the brand new community pool. The Honey Lake Valley Recreation Authority Board Members presented Susanville School District with a plaque, thanking the District for donating the property to build the new pool. Board Members and administration from the District worked with the City of Susanville and the County Board of Supervisors for several years to help bring this project to fruition. As part of the process, the old Roosevelt Pool Complex was demolished and abated so that the beautiful new community pool could be built. This great new addition to Lassen County is proof that when community agencies work together, they can create something special for future generations.
